summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 regarding technical issues with uploading PST files to the 'Epstein Relativity database'. It involves a Paralegal Specialist from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY coordinating access and file replacements for the investigation.

persons.name: AVillafana
persons.context: Appears as the custodian name in the file path for a PST file (\EOUSA-1\AVillafana_030115To031119_2_PRpst) that is part of the data being uploaded to the Epstein investigation database.

events.title: Request to Upload Emails to Epstein Database
events.description: A Paralegal Specialist from the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) sends an initial request to upload received emails to the 'Epstein Relativity database' for the USvEpstein-2018R01618 investigation and requests access to the database.

events.title: Report of Damaged PST Files
events.description: An email is sent reporting that several PST files from the EOUSA (Executive Office for United States Attorneys) are damaged and requesting replacements.

events.title: Follow-up on File Replacements
events.description: A follow-up email states the sender is working on getting replacements for the damaged PST files.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Shared network path: \\Usa.doj.gov\cloud\NYS\StAndrews\Shared\USvEpstein-2018R01618 Investigation OPR Materials
keyFacts: The document is part of the procedural workflow for uploading electronic evidence (PST files) to a dedicated Relativity database for the Epstein investigation (USvEpstein-2018R01618).
It reveals ongoing investigative activity by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) related to the Epstein case as late as September 2020.
Technical issues with damaged PST files from the EOUSA (Executive Office for United States Attorneys) are being addressed, indicating the scope of collected data.
The email chain shows coordination between a Paralegal Specialist and IT/administrative staff to manage evidence for the investigation.
